001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005
006/**
007 * A {@link DimensionLossFunction} that computes the squared error
008 * between an estimated value and its target value.
009 *
010 * <p>
011 * The squared error is defined as:
012 * <pre>
013 * SE = (estimated - target)^2
014 * </pre>
015 * </p>
016 *
017 * <p>
018 * This loss function penalizes larger deviations more heavily than
019 * smaller ones, making it widely used in regression problems and as
020 * the basis of the Mean Squared Error (MSE) objective.
021 * </p>
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * When combined with a {@link ScaledError} (e.g., with a factor of
025 * {@code 0.5}), it produces the conventional MSE formulation:
026 * <pre>
027 * MSE = 0.5 * (estimated - target)^2
028 * </pre>
029 */
030@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
031public class SquaredError<N extends Number> implements DimensionLossFunction<N> {
032
033    private final JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport;
034
035    public SquaredError(JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
036        this.typeSupport = typeSupport;
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * {@inheritDoc}
041     */
042    @Override
043    public N calculateDimensionLoss(N estimated, N target) {
044        N error = typeSupport.subtract(estimated, target);
045        return typeSupport.multiply(error, error);
046    }
047
048    /**
049     * {@inheritDoc}
050     */
051    @Override
052    public N calculateGradient_dl_da(N estimated, N target) {
053        N error = typeSupport.subtract(estimated, target);
054        return typeSupport.multiply(error, 2);
055    }
056
057    @Override
058    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getNumberTypeSupport() {
059        return typeSupport;
060    }
061}
